label: Wealthfront
description: Robo-advisor I use mainly for 5%+ high-yield cash account — their same-day-transfer feature helps me keep a minimum balance in our checking account to maximize interest.

referralLink.description: Get (and give me) a .5% APY boost for 3 months when you sign up with my referral link.
Get (and give me) $5,000 managed in an Automated Index Investment Account for free.

label: Fathom Analytics
description: A privacy-focused web analytics tool that helps me understand my traffic without compromising the privacy of my dear visitors — it doesn't track personal data or use cookies.

referralLink.description: Get $10 off your first invoice when you sign up with my referral link, I will get a 25% lifetime commission.

label: Raycast
description: A productivity tool for macOS that (in theory) enables me to do 95% of my work without touching the trackpad. The vibrant extension ecosystem has helped me create a very ergonomic workspace.

label: Bitwarden
description: An open-source password manager that replaced 1Password for me — they have a generous free tier which I tested out and never looked back!

label: Apple Notes
description: You were expecting Notion here, weren't you. Surprise! I prefer to use Apple’s built-in apps whenever possible (unless the alternative is at least 10x better). I love starting notes on my phone and picking up on my laptop and vice versa. It’s the simple things.

label: Costco Anywhere Visa
description: If you pair this card with the Executive Membership, you get a minimum 3% cash back on most purchases at Costco (1% min cash back w/ card + 2% annual member reward cash back). You have to spend an insanely low amount of money to break even — it’s a no-brainer.

label: Chase Sapphire
description: This used to be a great deal, but with the price increases and Priority Pass decreases, I would say it’s more on the average side. The travel insurance perk is nice, but not unique to this card.

referralLink.description: Earn 60,000 bonus points with the Chase Sapphire Preferred or Reserve Card when you sign up with my referral link, I think I get 10,000 points.

label: Robinhood Gold Card
description: There’s no way the 3% cash back on all purchases will last forever, so get this crazy offer while you can.

referralLink.description: You’ll help me get the solid gold card — if this happens I will buy you something with it.

label: Arc
description: Arc is radically different browser that helps you stay focused and organized while browsing the web. I've been using it as my full-time browser since Feb 2023 and it's changed the way I internet.

referralLink.description: Arc was (is?) possibly invite only for now...so here's an invite!

label: Robinhood
description: The first ever investing app I downloaded, Robinhood has a special place in my heart. I still use it to remind me that picking individual stocks is largely a fool’s errand. But as someone who stands to benefit if you use my referral link, I definitely recommend you use it.

referralLink.cta: Start trading and get a free stock!
referralLink.description: We both get free stock when you sign up and fund an account — 99% of rewards are worth $5. 1-in-100 customers can get at least $10; 1-in-1,000 can get $200.

label: The 3-2-1 Newsletter by James Clear
description: You’ve no doubt heard of James Clear, or at least his book ’Atomic Habits’ — I read it a few years ago, and while I’m still working on fully implementing all his principles, it’s definitely contributed to growth in my life.

label: Dense Discovery
description: Brought to you by the Kai Brach (creator of Offscreen), Dense Discovery brings you a weekly roundup of interesting things Kai has found on the web with a focus on sustainability and responsible tech.

label: Snacks
description: Robinhood’s weekly newsletter is a light hearted way to get the latest on the stock market — I generally skim the weekly newsletter and occasionally read one of the deep dives.

label: Money Stuff
description: Matt Levine is one of the most prolific financial writers — seriously it’s hard to believe he’s not just writing 24/7. I actually don’t read every newsletter, they’re so, so long — when I have an extra 20 minutes or an post seems extra interesting I’ll make time for it. It’s some of the best writing you’ll read.

label: Costco
description: Where else can you get prime grade brisket, a year’s supply of floss, a set of new tires, and a $1.50 hotdog while you wait to have them installed? Arguably the industry’s best return policy, and to top it off they treat their employees exceptionally well — Costco is almost too good to be true.

label: Sticker Mule
description: Sticker Mule is the gold standard for online printing — great quality, prices, and customer service.

referralLink.cta: Get a $10 credit with this link!
referralLink.description: You get a $10 credit, I get a small commission on your purchases for 1 year.
